name: Trazodone

dosing.adult_acute: Depression: 150 mg/day divided; Insomnia: 25-100 mg at bedtime
dosing.adult_maintenance: Depression: 300-600 mg/day divided BID-TID; Insomnia: 50-100 mg qHS
dosing.notes: Most commonly used OFF-LABEL for insomnia (25-100 mg); antidepressant doses much higher (300-600 mg); take with food to enhance absorption

canadian_clinical.starting_dose: Depression: 50-100 mg BID-TID; Insomnia: 25-50 mg qHS
canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Depression: Increase by 50 mg/day every 3-4 days; Insomnia: Titrate to effect (usually 50-100 mg)
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 400-600 mg/day for depression; 100-150 mg for insomnia
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Depression: Start 50-100 mg BID-TID; increase to 300-400 mg within 1-2 weeks
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Insomnia: Start 25-50 mg qHS; Depression: Start 50-100 mg BID, slow titration

warnings: Black box warning: Increased suicidal thinking in children/adolescents/young adults
PRIAPISM: Rare but serious (1 in 6000) - advise patients to seek immediate care for prolonged erection >4 hours
Orthostatic hypotension - risk falls in elderly
Sedation - useful for insomnia but can cause daytime drowsiness
QTc prolongation - use caution with other QTc-prolonging drugs
Serotonin syndrome risk when combined with other serotonergic agents

cautions.renal: No specific adjustment but use caution
cautions.hepatic: Use caution; reduced clearance in cirrhosis
